MapReads.string_process:
process MapReads {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/align/crams/" , mode: 'copy', overwrite: false
    input:
    tuple val(sample), file(reads)

    output:
    file(out_file)
    file("${out_file}.crai")

    script:
    r1 = reads[0]
    r2 = reads[1]
    
    script:
    out_file = "${sample}.cram"
   """
   bwa mem \
    -t $_THREADS -R "@RG\tID:$sample\tSM:$sample\tPL:$_PLATFORM\tPU:$sample\tLB:$sample" $ref_fasta $r1 $r2 \
    | samblaster \
    | samtools sort --output-fmt-option seqs_per_slice=4000 -O CRAM --reference $ref_fasta -m 18G -@ 6 /dev/stdin -o $out_file \
    && samtools index $out_file
    
   """
}
MapReads.string_script:
r1 = reads[0]
    r2 = reads[1]
    
    script:
    out_file = "${sample}.cram"
   """
   bwa mem \
    -t $_THREADS -R "@RG\tID:$sample\tSM:$sample\tPL:$_PLATFORM\tPU:$sample\tLB:$sample" $ref_fasta $r1 $r2 \
    | samblaster \
    | samtools sort --output-fmt-option seqs_per_slice=4000 -O CRAM --reference $ref_fasta -m 18G -@ 6 /dev/stdin -o $out_file \
    && samtools index $out_file
    
   """

tools_dico.name: CR10
tools_dico.description:
PUBLIC DATABASE OF COSMIC RADIATION MEASUREMENTS AT AVIATION ALTITUDES OF ABOUT 10 KM.

When using these data, please read this info

tools_dico.name: R2
tools_dico.description: R2 is a biologist friendly web based genomics analysis and visualization application

tools_dico.name: BWA
tools_dico.description: Fast, accurate, memory-efficient aligner for short and long sequencing reads

tools_dico.name: SAMBLASTER
tools_dico.description: A tool to mark duplicates and extract discordant and split reads from SAM files.

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

CramToBam.string_process:
process CramToBam{
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/align/bams" , mode: 'copy', overwrite: false
    input:
    file(cram)

    output:
    file(out_file)
    file("${out_file}.bai")

    script:
    sample = "${cram.simpleName}"
    out_file = "${sample}.bam"
    
    script:
   """
   samtools view -T $ref_fasta -b -o $out_file $cram \
   && samtools index $out_file
   """
}
CramToBam.string_script:
sample = "${cram.simpleName}"
    out_file = "${sample}.bam"
    
    script:
   """
   samtools view -T $ref_fasta -b -o $out_file $cram \
   && samtools index $out_file
   """

tools_dico.name: SAMPLE
tools_dico.description: The tool is designed to identify regions that are linked to a recessive disease by analysing genotype data from the parents and unaffected sibs of affected individuals. Since this analysis does not use data from affected patients, it is suited to the identification of lethal recessive genes, when the patients may have died before DNA samples could be obtained.

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

PreprocessIntervals.string_process:
process PreprocessIntervals {
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/preprocessed_intervals", mode: 'copy'
                  
    input:
                           
    
    output:
    file(out_file)
    script:
    out_file = 'preprocessed.interval_list'
    """
    gatk PreprocessIntervals \
        -L $intervals_list \
        -R $ref_fasta \
        --bin-length 0 \
        --interval-merging-rule OVERLAPPING_ONLY \
        -O $out_file
    """
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

CollectReadCounts.string_process:
process CollectReadCounts {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
                  
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/read_counts", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    file(cram)
    file(cram_index)
    file(preprocessed_intervals)

    output:
    file(out_file)

    script:
                                
                                      
    sample = cram.simpleName
    out_file = "${sample}.counts.hdf5"
    
    
    """
    gatk CollectReadCounts \
        -I $cram \
        -R $ref_fasta \
        -L $preprocessed_intervals \
        --interval-merging-rule OVERLAPPING_ONLY \
        -O $out_file
    """
}
CollectReadCounts.string_script:
sample = cram.simpleName
    out_file = "${sample}.counts.hdf5"
    
    
    """
    gatk CollectReadCounts \
        -I $cram \
        -R $ref_fasta \
        -L $preprocessed_intervals \
        --interval-merging-rule OVERLAPPING_ONLY \
        -O $out_file
    """

CreateReadCountSomaticPON.string_process:
process CreateReadCountSomaticPON {
    echo true
                    
    
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/read_count_somatic_pon", mode: 'copy'
    
    input:
                              'all_read_counts/*' 
    file(read_count_hdf5s)
    
                      

    output:
    file(out_file)

    script:
                                    
    out_file = "cnv.pon.hdf5"
    params_str = ''

                                  
    read_count_hdf5s.each{
        sample = it.simpleName
                                                                
        if (LLabUtils.sampleInList(sample, list_of_controls)){
          params_str = "${params_str} -I ${it}"
        }
    }

    
    """
    gatk CreateReadCountPanelOfNormals \
        $params_str \
        -O $out_file
    """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMPLE
tools_dico.description: The tool is designed to identify regions that are linked to a recessive disease by analysing genotype data from the parents and unaffected sibs of affected individuals. Since this analysis does not use data from affected patients, it is suited to the identification of lethal recessive genes, when the patients may have died before DNA samples could be obtained.

DenoiseReadCounts.string_process:
process DenoiseReadCounts {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/denoised_read_counts", mode: 'copy'
    
    input:
    file(sample_counts_hdf5)
    file(read_count_somatic_pon)

    output:
    file(std_copy_ratio)
    file(denoised_copy_ratio)

    script:
    sample = sample_counts_hdf5.simpleName
    std_copy_ratio = "${sample}.standardizedCR.tsv"
    denoised_copy_ratio = "${sample}.denoisedCR.tsv"
    
    """
    
    gatk DenoiseReadCounts \
        -I $sample_counts_hdf5 \
        --count-panel-of-normals $read_count_somatic_pon \
        --standardized-copy-ratios $std_copy_ratio \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $denoised_copy_ratio
    """
}
DenoiseReadCounts.string_script:
sample = sample_counts_hdf5.simpleName
    std_copy_ratio = "${sample}.standardizedCR.tsv"
    denoised_copy_ratio = "${sample}.denoisedCR.tsv"
    
    """
    
    gatk DenoiseReadCounts \
        -I $sample_counts_hdf5 \
        --count-panel-of-normals $read_count_somatic_pon \
        --standardized-copy-ratios $std_copy_ratio \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $denoised_copy_ratio
    """

PlotDenoisedCopyRatios.string_process:
process PlotDenoisedCopyRatios {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/denoisedCR_plots", mode: 'copy'
    
    input:
    file(std_copy_ratio)
    file(denoised_copy_ratio)

    output:
    file(out_dir)

    script:
    sample = std_copy_ratio.simpleName
    out_dir = "${sample}"
    
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk PlotDenoisedCopyRatios \
        --standardized-copy-ratios $std_copy_ratio \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $denoised_copy_ratio \
        --sequence-dictionary $ref_dict \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """
}
PlotDenoisedCopyRatios.string_script:
sample = std_copy_ratio.simpleName
    out_dir = "${sample}"
    
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk PlotDenoisedCopyRatios \
        --standardized-copy-ratios $std_copy_ratio \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $denoised_copy_ratio \
        --sequence-dictionary $ref_dict \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """

RunModelSegments.string_process:
process RunModelSegments {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/modeled_segments", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
    
    input:
    file(case_denoisedCR)

    output:
    file(out_dir)
    file("${out_dir}/${sample}.cr.seg")
    file("${out_dir}/${sample}.modelFinal.seg")

    script:
    sample = case_denoisedCR.simpleName
    out_dir = "${sample}_modeled_segments"
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk ModelSegments \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $case_denoisedCR \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """
}
RunModelSegments.string_script:
sample = case_denoisedCR.simpleName
    out_dir = "${sample}_modeled_segments"
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk ModelSegments \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $case_denoisedCR \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """

PlotModeledSegments.string_process:
process PlotModeledSegments {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/modeled_segments_plots", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
    
    input:
    file("denoised_crs/*")
    file(model_final_seg)

    output:
    file(out_dir)

    script:
    sample = model_final_seg.simpleName
    sample_denoised_cr = "denoised_crs/${sample}.denoisedCR.tsv"
    out_dir = "${sample}"
    
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk PlotModeledSegments \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $sample_denoised_cr \
        --segments $model_final_seg \
        --sequence-dictionary $ref_dict \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """
}
PlotModeledSegments.string_script:
sample = model_final_seg.simpleName
    sample_denoised_cr = "denoised_crs/${sample}.denoisedCR.tsv"
    out_dir = "${sample}"
    
    """
    mkdir $out_dir
    gatk PlotModeledSegments \
        --denoised-copy-ratios $sample_denoised_cr \
        --segments $model_final_seg \
        --sequence-dictionary $ref_dict \
        --output-prefix $sample \
        -O $out_dir
    """

CallCopyRatioSegments.string_process:
process CallCopyRatioSegments {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
    
    publishDir "$publish_dir", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
    
    input:
    file(cr_seg)
    
    output:
    file(out_file)
                        

    script:
    sample = cr_seg.simpleName
    publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/called_cr_segments"
    out_file = "${sample}.called.seg"
    
    """
    gatk CallCopyRatioSegments \
        -I $cr_seg \
        -O $out_file
    """
}
CallCopyRatioSegments.string_script:
sample = cr_seg.simpleName
    publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/called_cr_segments"
    out_file = "${sample}.called.seg"

    gatk CallCopyRatioSegments \
        -I $cr_seg \

GetGeneSummaryGATK.string_process:
process GetGeneSummaryGATK{
    
    echo true
    publishDir "${OUT_DIR}/misc/gene_summary_gatk", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true

    input:
    file(called_seg)
                      

    output:
    file "$out_file"

    script:
    out_file = "${called_seg.simpleName}_gatk_gene_summary.txt"    
    
    """
    cat $called_seg | grep '^chr[1-9XY]' > ${called_seg}.modified
    bgzip ${called_seg}.modified
    tabix -s 1 -b 2 -e 3 ${called_seg}.modified.gz
    export f=${called_seg}.modified.gz  
    cat $homo_sapiens_genes \
    | gargs -p 8 'echo -en "{3}\t"; tabix \$f {0}:{1}-{2}' \
    |awk 'BEGIN {OFS = FS} {if (\$NF != 0) print \$1,\$NF}' > ${out_file}
    """
}
GetGeneSummaryGATK.string_script:
out_file = "${called_seg.simpleName}_gatk_gene_summary.txt"    
    
    """
    cat $called_seg | grep '^chr[1-9XY]' > ${called_seg}.modified
    bgzip ${called_seg}.modified
    tabix -s 1 -b 2 -e 3 ${called_seg}.modified.gz
    export f=${called_seg}.modified.gz  
    cat $homo_sapiens_genes \
    | gargs -p 8 'echo -en "{3}\t"; tabix \$f {0}:{1}-{2}' \
    |awk 'BEGIN {OFS = FS} {if (\$NF != 0) print \$1,\$NF}' > ${out_file}
    """

GenSavvyCNVCoverageSummary.string_process:
process GenSavvyCNVCoverageSummary {
    echo true
    tag "$sample"
                  
    publishDir "$publish_dir", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
    
    input:
    file(bam)
    file(bam_index)
    
    output:
    file(out_file)
                        

    script:
    sample = bam.simpleName
    publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/SavvyCNV_coverage_summaries"
    out_file = "${sample}.coverageBinner"
    
    """
    java -Xmx1g CoverageBinner $bam >$out_file 
    """
}
GenSavvyCNVCoverageSummary.string_script:
sample = bam.simpleName
    publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/SavvyCNV_coverage_summaries"
    out_file = "${sample}.coverageBinner"
    
    """
    java -Xmx1g CoverageBinner $bam >$out_file 
    """

RunSavvyCNV.string_process:
process RunSavvyCNV {
    echo true
                  
                    
    
    publishDir "$publish_dir", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
    
    input:
    file("*")
    
    output:
    file("cnv_list.csv")
    file("log_messages.txt")
    file("*.pdf")
             

    script:
                              
    publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/SavvyCNV_calls"
                                            
    chunk_size = 200000
    
    """
    java -Xmx30g SavvyCNV -a -d $chunk_size *.coverageBinner >cnv_list.csv 2>log_messages.txt
    """
}

RunCNVKitBatchMode.string_process:
process RunCNVKitBatchMode{
  echo true
                
  publishDir "$publish_dir", mode: 'copy', overwrite: true
  
  input:
    file("*")
    file("*")
  
  output:
  file('results')

  script:
                                                        
  case_bams='' 
  control_bams = ''
  list_of_cases.each{ case_bams += "${it}.bam "}
  list_of_controls.each{ control_bams += "${it}.bam "}

  publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/CNVKit_calls"
  """
  ls -al .
  cnvkit.py batch -p32 $case_bams \
      --normal $control_bams \
      --targets $intervals_list\
      --fasta $ref_fasta  \
      --output-reference my_reference.cnn --output-dir results \
      --scatter
  """
}
RunCNVKitBatchMode.string_script:
case_bams='' 
  control_bams = ''
  list_of_cases.each{ case_bams += "${it}.bam "}
  list_of_controls.each{ control_bams += "${it}.bam "}

  publish_dir = "${OUT_DIR}/misc/CNVKit_calls"
  """
  ls -al .
  cnvkit.py batch -p32 $case_bams \
      --normal $control_bams \
      --targets $intervals_list\
      --fasta $ref_fasta  \
      --output-reference my_reference.cnn --output-dir results \
      --scatter
  """

TestProc.string_process:
process TestProc {
    echo true

    input:
    file("*")
    file("*")
    
    """
    ls -al .
    """
}
